PeopleAPI

Graph based API to get People or Employee information, including their relationships like line managers, reporting line and office location. You can use an Employee query if employee id is known or use a Search query to look up an Employee.

CodeSamples: [Code]

employees (ids: [String], dataSet: DataSet) : [Employee]

Navigate employee graph via this query, you will use this if you have access to Employee ID otherwise use search query. Returns multiple employee objects for the array of ids provided.

Argument Type Description
ids [String] Array of employee ids
dataSet DataSet Data set type from which people data is to be accessed. Currently it is BCG_IT(only IT people) or BCG_ALL(BCG worldwide people)

employee (id: String, field: String, dataSet: DataSet) : Employee

Navigate employee graph via this query, you will use this if you have access to Employee ID otherwise use search query. Returns an Employee object.

Argument Type Description
id String Employee Id
field String  
dataSet DataSet Data set type from which people data is to be accessed. Currently it is BCG_IT(only IT people) or BCG_ALL(BCG worldwide people)

Deprecatedsearch (find: String, filter: String, limit: Int, offset: Int, dataSet: DataSet, sortBy: String, filters: [String], filterType: FilterType) : [Employee] Search has been deprecated, Use peopleSearch() instead DEPRECATED - Search has been deprecated, Use peopleSearch() instead, Lookup employee by name, title or any other information you know. Returns a list of employees

Argument Type Description
find String Value of find should be an Employee name eg : “Lastname, Firstname”
filter String Value of filter should be filter name followed by equalTo symbol(=) and then value eg : “hostOfficeCode=CHI”
limit Int Size of the page. Default is 30. Works for both filter and find
offset Int Offset/start index of page. Default is 0. Works for both filter and find
dataSet DataSet Data set type from which people data is to be accessed. Currently it is BCG_IT(only IT people) or BCG_ALL(BCG worldwide people)
sortBy String A field name by which the list is suppose to be ordered by
filters [String] Two or more filters separated by commas(,). Use filterType enum with this
filterType FilterType Filter type OR/AND/NOT. Default is OR

peopleSearch (find: String, filter: String, limit: Int, offset: Int, dataSet: DataSet, sortBy: String, filters: [String], filterType: FilterType) : Employees

Lookup employee by name, title or any other information you know. Returns an object with list of employees and totalCount.

Argument Type Description
find String Value of find should be an Employee name eg : “Lastname, Firstname”
filter String Value of filter should be filter name followed by equalTo symbol(=) and then value eg : “hostOfficeCode=CHI”
limit Int Size of the page. Default is 30. Works for both filter and find
offset Int Offset/start index of page. Default is 0. Works for both filter and find
dataSet DataSet Data set type from which people data is to be accessed. Currently it is BCG_IT(only IT people) or BCG_ALL(BCG worldwide people)
sortBy String A field name by which the list is suppose to be ordered by.
filters [String] Two or more filters separated by commas(,). Use filterType enum with this
filterType FilterType Filter type OR/AND/NOT. Default is OR

searchFilter (find: String, filters: [search], resultFilters: [String], limit: Int, offset: Int, dataSet: DataSet, sortBy: [String], sortOrder: SortOrder) : Employees

Lookup location by name, title or any other information you know. Returns the matching location objects as an array.

Argument Type Description
find String Find employee by name or designation i.e. search on fields: “Lastname, Firstname, Title, PracticeArea Topic, JobFunction, GlobalTitle”
filters [search] Two or more filters separated by commas(,). Use filterType enum with this
resultFilters [String] Possible filters and available result counts
limit Int Size of the page. Default is 30. Works for both filter and find
offset Int Offset/start index of page. Default is 0. Works for both filter and find
dataSet DataSet Data set type from which people data is to be accessed. Currently it is BCG_IT(only IT people) or BCG_ALL(BCG worldwide people)
sortBy [String] A field name by which the list is suppose to be ordered by.
sortOrder SortOrder Order of sorting.

jobFunctions (dataSet: DataSet) : [JobFunction]

Returns list of all distinct job functions

Argument Type Description
dataSet DataSet Data set type from which people data is to be accessed. Currently it is BCG_IT(only IT people) or BCG_ALL(BCG worldwide people)

practiceAreas : [PracticeArea]

Returns list of all practice area objects

cohorts (dataSet: DataSet) : [String]

Returns list of all distinct cohorts

Argument Type Description
dataSet DataSet Data set type from which people data is to be accessed. Currently it is BCG_IT(only IT people) or BCG_ALL(BCG worldwide people)

preferences (employeeId: String!, key: String) : [OutputPreference]

Returns list of preferences

Argument Type Description
employeeId String! Employee ID for which all preferences needs to be fetched
key String preference type for which all preferences needs to be fetched

team (teamId: String) : TeamOutput

Return team for given team Id

Argument Type Description
teamId String Team Id

teams (employeeId: String!) : [TeamOutput]

Returns list of all the teams for an employee

Argument Type Description
employeeId String! Employee ID for which all teams needs to be fetched

allTeams : [TeamOutput]

Returns list of all the teams

entitlements : [String]

Returns list of all groups of an employee

topicCategories (topicId: String, sortBy: String) : [Topic]

List of all topic role categories

Argument Type Description
topicId String topic id
sortBy String A field name by which the list is suppose to be ordered by.

topicGroups (categoryId: String, sortBy: String) : [RoleGroup]

List all topic role groups

Argument Type Description
categoryId String category id
sortBy String A field name by which the list is suppose to be ordered by.
